Posts.Content: Jun 12, 2009 02:07PM RoxanneC wrote: There are alot of great suggestions here for a 'chemo bag', afighter. The gatorade is to help keep you hydrated, the crackers are for something 'lite' on your tummy. I found that the hard candies really helped with the metallic taste that I got while I was getting my chemo. You will find much info and support here sweetie. I also had my dear hubby with me at all of my chemo treatments, which helped alot. Good luck and prayers will be with you! And angeljoy...ditto about anything red after adriamycin. Red jello even made me shudder. Thankfully..3 years later, the red no longer bothers me.
Posts.Title: What do you pack for Chemo? BShoemaker Moderators

Posts.Content: Apr 19, 2009 01:04PM RoxanneC wrote: For the first 2 years, I read way too much and gained 'too' much info on what to eat and not to eat or drink. This is the start of my 3rd year survival and I've decided to "live". So, once again, I am putting that little spoon of sugar in my coffee in the morning. Making sweet suntea, and having a candy bar once in awhile. I figured I could keep depriving myself of things that I liked and possibly get a recurrance---or--- start enjoying things that I liked again..and possibly get a recurrance. I believe it's up to the person on which studies they want to believe. There is soo much info out there. But according to God, All things are good in moderation. So that is what I'm going to live by.
